TopicTitle: KSP Grandmaster! (Land on every body of the Kerbal System!)

Articles.Content:
Mechjeb is not a physical mod.

it used to be... still you cant use it....

wow i feel old now... i remember mechjeb pods.....

I've been procrastinating completing this challenge for sooo long...

but I already know I'm going to start it from scratch when flags come out :/

I don't know about stickying yet, but you guys could, you know, rate this thread so people know it's a good challenge

And rather than having lots of stickies I'd prefer a thread that linked to the top 100 challenges maybe (hint hint)

And rather than having lots of stickies I'd prefer a thread that linked to the top 100 challenges maybe (hint hint)

how do you rate a thread?

how do you rate a thread?

good question, I just realized the thread rating system doesn't exist anymore: is this because of the forum purge?

also, another thing that has disappeared is the reputation tab on the user CP.
Hmm... odd. Also, check out my latest update: Dres!

Must try this. Might take a while though. Done the easy already (kerbin,mun,minmus,duna,eve) although didn`t start taking screenshots until after I had been to Mun and Eve but it is easy enough to go back. Will there be a grandmaster badge or something for a grandmasters sig?

Will post results in a while...

update:duna,moho and dres.5 to go V

Edited May 22, 2013 by Spartwo
wow nice job guys! anyone close to finished?
What the hell is that thing on Bop?

I should do this. Given that I never bring anyone home, I'm already over halfway done!

I have Kerbals on Eve, Duna, Ike, Minmus, Mun, Laythe, Bop and Vall.

I have a lander orbiting Moho already, just haven't bothered to land.

I have a station around Dres.

The only time I decided to return to Kerbin was my Eeloo mission, after landing, so I'd need to get someone back there.

What the hell is that thing on Bop?
kracken baby.also bop with a prototype rover. Edited May 22, 2013 by Spartwo

I`ve decided to make a stock single Kerbal lander that will go anywhere in the system just for the challenge. It was basically just a huge probe with a kerbal in the nose. I made V1.0 to get into LKO with 7000m/s Dv (2000 on the lander) thinking that would be more than enough and it was not. Tylo, Moho and Eeloo either need a better pilot than me or more Dv so I made V2.0 which through judicious use of extra boosters and shaving off of some weight now has an extra 1500 Dv giving ~8500 Dv to play with once in LKO(75Km). Tylo 2 has landed and now I just need to relaunch GM Moho 2 and wait for GM Eeloo 2 to get to the outer system. GM Gilly and GM Vall are on course for SOI and I`m doing the rest of the Jool burns tonight.

Update for me

Moho

Eve *Done*

Gilly *SOI*

Kerbin *Done*

Duna *Done*

Ike *Done*

Dres

Laythe *Done*

Vall *SOI*

Tylo *Done*

Bop

Pol

Eeloo

Having trouble with Moho, Tylo was a real pain and Eeloo will take years (in game). Duna and Eve were easy, just aim for the edge of it and deploy the parachutes (as long as you hit some land). Laythe was only tricky because there wasn`t much land...

I reckon I might get it done this week.

What does SOI mean?

What does SOI mean?

SOI=Sphere of Influence, it`s the range of influence of a planets gravity. You can only orbit a body within its sphere of influence as far as I know. (at least within the game)
Flags or it didn't happen

I found out the hard way that the mountains on some of the Jool moons are over 15Km high (by trying to orbit at 15km), Bop I think.

Only Pol to go.

Then I suppose I`ll have to do it all again with flags.....

Edited May 23, 2013 by John FX
Update (landed on Dres)

Finally done it. Some late nights and early mornings (and all day in between sometimes), lots of quicksaving, immense help from alarm clock mod (assumed was ok, doesn`t control anything, just lets you set a maneuver node, go to a different ship and not lose the node and has a list of what event is next with alarms) and lots of coffee.

Here are my Brave, never to return, Kerbals who in the name of me, decided to go to a far flung body of the system, take a picture and send it back.

They went to Moho,

Eve and Gilly

There was a very quick and scary launch to Kerbin

Duna and Ike,

Dres

The 5 moons of Jool

And Finally Eeloo

Here is my craft. I borrowed the launcher from Molab IV and added a few nuclear engines to an orange tank and a basic lander that should be able to land anywhere in the system. Except for a couple of places where I had to keep the nuclear engines running almost into the ground (I`m looking at you Moho, Tylo and Eeloo) before dropping them it had plenty of Delta-V. It was a case of No no no no no no no when I discovered the over 15km mountains on bop but that was most of the drama. It has a few parachutes and a couple of engines for where the parachutes aren`t enough or you need to lose some speed before deploying. Plenty of RCS for lateral adjustment on landing (Although the RCS placement needs looking at)

It likes to get a bit of height before gravity turn and a bit of RCS to turn when you need to adjust your orbit at Pe. You should have about 8500Dv at 75Km LKO (more if you are careful or lose some RCS from the tank on the launchpad)lander 2-2.5k Dv + nuclear ~5000Dv +1000 last launch stage

Most places you don`t need to be careful with your burns.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/12775588/GM%20Universal%20Lander%202.craft

Edited May 24, 2013 by John FX
Forgot to include Dres screenshot
